posts.post_content: What's not to like? Two of these on your first and second turns and an island on your third gives you access to up to five blue mana. Ramp doesn't get a whole lot better than that in blue. Proliferate is nice too. I've had six counters on a couple of these things before.

posts.post_content:
Stlye points for using this along with [Land Cap](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Land Cap) with [Quicksilver Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Quicksilver Elemental), [Skill Borrower](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skill Borrower) or [Necrotic Ooze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necrotic Ooze).  
(Works of course with every deplition land from *Mercadican Masks* and *Ice Age*.)  
  
Proliferate (e.g. with [Hummingbird](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hummingbird)) would be more efficient, though.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: Pretty much WotC's first attempt at the 'Vivid' lands, although mono-colored. Still Proliferate greatly increased the effectiveness of these lands. Back then, I wouldn't even give these 1 star; now, after using them extensively in proliferate decks, I give them 4/5.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
4 mana over three turns, that is what this gives you. Every instance of Proliferate increases that count by 2/1.   
  
Is it good? In older decks, where fast mana is a necessity, yes. In newer decks with Proliferate, it's even better. Outside of those kinds of decks, stick with your islands.
posts.html:
